intro: Salsola asparagoides, commonly known as sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its low-growing, sprawling habit and fleshy, succulent leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters, which are typically followed by dry, three-angled fruits. It is well adapted to harsh environments, with deep roots that help it survive in poor soil and extreme temperatures. Salsola asparagoides plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and is sometimes used in ecological restoration projects.
